Function Documentation

PIZBoundedStack* pizBoundedStackNew ( long  size  ) 

Create the stack.

In case of failure the pointer is NULL.

Parameters:
size The maximum number of values in the stack.
Returns:
A pointer to the new queue.

void pizBoundedStackFree ( PIZBoundedStack *  x  ) 

Free the stack.

It is safe to pass NULL pointer.

Parameters:
x A Pointer.

void pizBoundedStackClear ( PIZBoundedStack *  x  ) 

Clear the stack.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.

PIZError pizBoundedStackPush ( PIZBoundedStack *  x,
long  value 
)

Stack a value.

Return PIZ_ERROR if the number of values is over the size of the stack.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
value The value to append.
Returns:
An error code.

PIZError pizBoundedStackPop ( PIZBoundedStack *  x  ) 

Unstack a value.

To get the unstacked value use pizBoundedStackPoppedValue(). Return PIZ_ERROR if the queue is empty.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
An error code.

long pizBoundedStackCount ( const PIZBoundedStack *  x  ) 

Get the number of values in the stack.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
The number of values.

long pizBoundedStackPoppedValue ( const PIZBoundedStack *  x  ) 

Get the unstacked value.

This value is initialized with -1.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
The value.
